snippet: Higher demand in Asia, difficult weather in the major cocoa-producing countries in West Africa and attacks of fungus are contributing to the price increases.
abstract: Variety of factors including high global demand for chocolate and environmental conditions affecting West African cocoa trees are driving prices of cocoa, and thus chocolate, higher; prices this Valentine's Day for chocolate may be up to 8 percent higher than in 2014; chocolate makers like Mondelez have increased prices or changed formulas and packaging to account for higher cocoa prices, bringing consumer backlash.
lead_paragraph: Higher demand in Asia, difficult weather in the major cocoa-producing countries in West Africa and attacks of fungus are contributing to the price increases.

headline.main: Valentine’s Day Chocolate Will Cost More This Year, as Cocoa Prices Rise
headline.print_headline: That Heart-Shaped Box Will Cost More This Year, as Cocoa Prices Rise
